Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                              The M.S. in Public Relations and Corporate Communication is a 42-credit program, including a core curriculum focused on communication, ethics, law, social media strategies, research methodologies, and regulatory practices. The degree also features a concentration, in either public relations management or corporate and organizational communication; a practicum project in which you prepare, present, and potentially launch a communication plan that meets a real need for a real organization; and a capstone project, which is a publication-ready thesis paper that makes an original contribution to the field.   The program is designed to meet the needs of both working professionals and full-time students, allowing opportunities for either part-time or full-time study in any semester. It can be completed in two years of full-time study, or in up to five years of part-time study.   The program, though mainly classroom-based, also is making important strides with distance learning, especially with respect to the pedagogical methodologies that will work best in what has been called "The Age of the Conversation."           Expand All   Collapse All          Core Curriculum        The core curriculum is designed to provide you with a deep and broad foundation that supports concentration coursework and serves you throughout your career. Students are required to take all of the following courses.     Students enrolled prior to fall 2009 may use Social Media: Objectives, Strategies, Tactics as a concentration elective course requirement.                      Course     Title     Credits                                           PRCC1-GC1010                                                    Communications Ethics, Law & Regulation                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1020                                                    Public Relations Writing Seminar I                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1030                                                    Public Relations Writing Seminar II                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1070                           Online Course                                            Social Media:Objectives, Strategies, Tactics                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1080                                                    Practicum                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1900                                                    Research Process & Methodology                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC4000                                                    Capstone                         3.0                             Concentrations           Public Relations Management       Students are required to take the following courses.                      Course     Title     Credits                                           PRCC1-GC1000                                                    Theory, History & Prac of Public Relations                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1040                                                    Managing Media Relations                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1050                                                    Critical Business Skills for Corporate Communictn                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1060                           Online Course                                            Strategic Communications                         3.0                        Students select three of the following courses or two of the following courses and one course from the corporate and organizational communication concentration below.                        Course     Title     Credits                                           PRCC1-GC2200                                                    Public Relations Consulting                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2210                                                    Public Relations in Non-Profit Organizations                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2220                                                    Public Relations Specialties                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2230                                                    Integrated Marketing                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2240                                                    Global Relations & Intercltrl Communctns                         3.0                          Corporate and Organizational Communication       Students are required to take the following courses.                      Course     Title     Credits                                           PRCC1-GC1000                                                    Theory, History & Prac of Public Relations                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1040                                                    Managing Media Relations                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1050                                                    Critical Business Skills for Corporate Communictn                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC1060                           Online Course                                            Strategic Communications                         3.0                        Students select three of the following courses or two of the following courses and one course from the public relations management concentration above.                        Course     Title     Credits                                           PRCC1-GC2100                                                    Public Affairs: Public Opinion & Issues Mngmnt                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2110                                                    Building Pblcs: Employee & Other Constituencies                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2120                                                    Investor Relations                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2130                                                    Community Relations & Advocacy Communications                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2140                                                    Government Affairs                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2150                                                    Crisis Communication                         3.0                                                PRCC1-GC2160                                                    Reputation Management                         3.0                             Optional Courses                     Course     Title     Credits                                           PRCC1-GC3901                                                    Internship                         1.0                                                PRCC1-GC4005                                                    Prcc Capstone Extension                         0.0                                Ready to Proceed? M.S. in Public Relations and Corporate Communication                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Marketing and Public Relations                                                                                           About             Faculty News                   Admissions                 Academics             Graduate Programs Noncredit Offerings                   Career                 Events                 Alumni                                                   M.S. in Public Relations and Corporate Communication                                          Graduate Programs ›                M.S. in Integrated Marketing            M.S. in Public Relations and Corporate Communication                 Curriculum          Opportunities and Outcomes          Faculty          Admissions Process                                        Ready to Proceed?           Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                 M.S in Public Relations and Corporate Communication          feature subtitle 1          feature text                                Concentrations           Public Relations Management         Corporate and Organizational Communication               In this transformative era in which social and other digital media are redefining the world of communication, companies in nearly every industry require coordinated and ongoing public relations campaigns to achieve their goals. Customer experience, online communities, and social networking have created the need for PR professionals with a very different set of skills than those of their predecessors.   For the public relations industry, the greatest challenge today is the dearth of new talent—the demand for PR professionals is growing faster than the talent pool. According to the Public Relations Society of America, spending on public relations increased substantially in 2010, and is forecast to go up to $8.1 billion over the next five years.       That’s why the M.S in Public Relations and Corporate Communication is so critical. Through this program and its innovative curriculum, we are teaching and are graduating high-caliber students who will satisfy the increasing demand for PR professionals. These individuals must be well versed in industry trends and must be able to apply new technology and new methods of communication to develop and to implement effective public relations plans.             Program Locations : NYU Midtown Center , Online             View General Curriculum            Learn More            NYU School of Professional Studies faculty and staff members look forward to learning more about you, and we want you to learn more about us, to ensure that your decisions regarding your educational experience are well informed. Our admissions staff is here to partner with you throughout the admissions process. Please do not hesitate to contact us .                   Ready to Proceed?
